New Records: Bobby Witt Jr. hit the decisive hit for the second consecutive game in the Wild Card Series.
Key Match Events: Witt hit a grounder to the edge of the dirt behind second base, where Jordan Westburg made a diving stop and throw to first, allowing Kyle Isbel to score from third.
The Royals left 12 runners on base and got through another close game with a razor-thin margin for error thanks to some masterful managing by Matt Quatraro.
Pre-Game Insights: Second baseman Michael Massey said the front office bringing in experienced veterans with previous playoff experience helped the team.
Post-Match Reflections: The Orioles were swept in their only playoff series for a second consecutive year, going 1 for 13 with runners in scoring position this time and 5 for 32 combined.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals face the AL East champion New York Yankees in the ALDS, with Game 1 scheduled for Saturday in the Bronx.
Others: Left fielder Colton Cowser struck out despite a pitch hitting him in the left hand in the fifth and stayed in through the sixth before leaving with pain in his hand.
